title: Disomic, Fibroblast, Female, 2 Day old, replicate 1
growth_protocol_ch1: Cells were passaged in DMEM with 10% FBS
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was prepared using the RNeasy Kit from Qiagen
extract_protocol_ch1.1: Libraries were prepared using the Truseq Stranded Kit from Illumina
description: polyA RNA from Disomic Fibroblastoid cells
data_processing: Basecalls performed using bcl2fastq_v1.8.4 with the following options (--mismatches 1 fastq-cluster-count 0 )
data_processing.1: FASTQC v0.11.2 was used to determine sequence quality
data_processing.2: fastqc-mcf was used to trim low quality bases, adapters and N content from 3’ end (<q10). Removed reads that were shorter than 30bp after trimming
data_processing.3: Reads were mapped using Tophat2 (v2.0.13) with the following options (--b2-sensitive --keep-fasta-order --no-coverage-search --max-multihits 10 --library-type fr-firststrand)
data_processing.4: Reads with MAPQ > 10 were kept using Samtools (v0.1.19)
data_processing.5: Reads were coordinate sorted and duplicates were marked using Picard (v1.129)
data_processing.6: Raw count data was generated using HTSeq (v0.6.1) with the following options (--stranded=reverse –minaqual=10 –type=exon –idattr=gene --mode=intersection-nonempty)
data_processing.8: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab delimited text files containing raw gene counts for each sample
contact_department: Pharmacology & Linda Crnic Institute for Down Syndrome
contact_institute: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
contact_address: RC1-N, Mail Stop 8303, Rm. P18-6114 12800 E. 19th Ave.

title: Trisomic, Fibroblast, Male, 2 Year old, replicate 2
growth_protocol_ch1: Cells were passaged in DMEM with 10% FBS
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was prepared using the RNeasy Kit from Qiagen
extract_protocol_ch1.1: Libraries were prepared using the Truseq Stranded Kit from Illumina
description: polyA RNA from Trisomic Fibroblastoid cells
data_processing: Basecalls performed using bcl2fastq_v1.8.4 with the following options (--mismatches 1 fastq-cluster-count 0 )
data_processing.1: FASTQC v0.11.2 was used to determine sequence quality
data_processing.2: fastqc-mcf was used to trim low quality bases, adapters and N content from 3’ end (<q10). Removed reads that were shorter than 30bp after trimming
data_processing.3: Reads were mapped using Tophat2 (v2.0.13) with the following options (--b2-sensitive --keep-fasta-order --no-coverage-search --max-multihits 10 --library-type fr-firststrand)
data_processing.4: Reads with MAPQ > 10 were kept using Samtools (v0.1.19)
data_processing.5: Reads were coordinate sorted and duplicates were marked using Picard (v1.129)
data_processing.6: Raw count data was generated using HTSeq (v0.6.1) with the following options (--stranded=reverse –minaqual=10 –type=exon –idattr=gene --mode=intersection-nonempty)
data_processing.8: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab delimited text files containing raw gene counts for each sample
contact_department: Pharmacology & Linda Crnic Institute for Down Syndrome
contact_institute: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
contact_address: RC1-N, Mail Stop 8303, Rm. P18-6114 12800 E. 19th Ave.

extract_protocol_ch1.1: Libraries were prepared using the Truseq Stranded Kit from Illumina
description: polyA RNA from Trisomic Lymphoblastoid cells
data_processing: Basecalls performed using bcl2fastq_v1.8.4 with the following options (--mismatches 1 fastq-cluster-count 0 )
data_processing.1: FASTQC v0.11.2 was used to determine sequence quality
data_processing.2: fastqc-mcf was used to trim low quality bases, adapters and N content from 3’ end (<q10). Removed reads that were shorter than 30bp after trimming
data_processing.3: Reads were mapped using Tophat2 (v2.0.13) with the following options (--b2-sensitive --keep-fasta-order --no-coverage-search --max-multihits 10 --library-type fr-firststrand)
data_processing.4: Reads with MAPQ > 10 were kept using Samtools (v0.1.19)
data_processing.5: Reads were coordinate sorted and duplicates were marked using Picard (v1.129)
data_processing.6: Raw count data was generated using HTSeq (v0.6.1) with the following options (--stranded=reverse –minaqual=10 –type=exon –idattr=gene --mode=intersection-nonempty)
data_processing.8: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab delimited text files containing raw gene counts for each sample
contact_department: Pharmacology & Linda Crnic Institute for Down Syndrome
contact_institute: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
contact_address: RC1-N, Mail Stop 8303, Rm. P18-6114 12800 E. 19th Ave.
